  • Rishi Mehta

entry.title: Emerging climate impact on carbon sinks in a consolidated carbon budget (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Emerging climate impact on carbon sinks in a consolidated carbon budget

  • Pierre Friedlingstein
  • Corinne Le Quéré
  • Hanqin Tian
Article12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Controlling pyramidal nitrogen chirality by asymmetric organocatalysis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Controlling pyramidal nitrogen chirality by asymmetric organocatalysis

An asymmetric organocatalysis strategy is used to control pyramidal nitrogen chirality and to synthesize the enantioselective N-chloroaziridines with a configurationally stable nitrogen stereogenic centre.

  • San Wu
  • Pengquan Chen
  • Bin Tan
Article12 Nov 2025

entry.title: In situ structural mechanism of epothilone-B-induced CNS axon regeneration (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
In situ structural mechanism of epothilone-B-induced CNS axon regeneration

A combined cryo-electron tomography and cryo-electron microscopy pipeline was developed to inflict axonal damage and monitor the cellular response induced by epothilone B, revealing that microtubule polymerization at and beyond the lesion site promote axon regeneration.

  • Satish Bodakuntla
  • Kenichiro Taira
  • Naoko Mizuno
Article12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Ecology and spread of the North American H5N1 epizootic (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Ecology and spread of the North American H5N1 epizootic

The panzootic of highly pathogenic H5N1 since 2021 was driven by around nine introductions into the Atlantic and Pacific flyways, followed by rapid dissemination through wild migratory birds, primarily Anseriformes.

  • Lambodhar Damodaran
  • Anna S. Jaeger
  • Louise H. Moncla
ArticleOpen Access12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Estimation and mapping of the missing heritability of human phenotypes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Estimation and mapping of the missing heritability of human phenotypes

WGS data were used from 347,630 individuals with European ancestry in the UK Biobank to obtain high-precision estimates of coding and non-coding rare variant heritability for 34 complex traits and diseases.

  • Pierrick Wainschtein
  • Yuanxiang Zhang
  • Loic Yengo
ArticleOpen Access12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Spatial fibroblast niches define Crohn’s fistulae (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Spatial fibroblast niches define Crohn’s fistulae

Spatial transcriptomic analysis of cells in intestinal fistulae of patients with Crohn’s disease reveals the existence of specialized fistula-associated cell states with distinct signalling profiles and extracellular matrix architecture.

  • Colleen McGregor
  • Xiao Qin
  • Alison Simmons
ArticleOpen Access12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Florigen activation complex forms via multifaceted assembly in Arabidopsis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Florigen activation complex forms via multifaceted assembly in Arabidopsis

In flowering plants, DNA–FD–14-3-3 recruits FT to the florigen activation complex both through DNA–FT interactions and by reducing liquid phase condensation of FD protein, which promotes dimerization, leading to FT recruitment.

  • He Gao
  • Na Ding
  • George Coupland
ArticleOpen Access12 Nov 2025

entry.title: The contribution of rock strength to soil production (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The contribution of rock strength to soil production

Findings from a tectonically active mountain range show that soil production is driven by bottom-up rock weakening rather than by soil thickness, challenging long-held top-down models.

  • Emily C. Geyman
  • David A. Paige
  • Michael P. Lamb
Article12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Mortality impacts of rainfall and sea-level rise in a developing megacity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Mortality impacts of rainfall and sea-level rise in a developing megacity

High-resolution rainfall, tide and mortaility data are used to quantify the impact of rainfall and flooding on urban health in Mumbai, India, revealing an order-of-magnitude discrepency between observed and officially reported mortality impacts, with slum residents bearing most of the burden.

  • Tom Bearpark
  • Ashwin Rode
  • Archana Patankar
Article12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Aligning machine and human visual representations across abstraction levels (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Aligning machine and human visual representations across abstraction levels

Aligning foundation models with human judgments enables them to more accurately approximate human behaviour and uncertainty across various levels of visual abstraction, while additionally improving their generalization performance.

  • Lukas Muttenthaler
  • Klaus Greff
  • Andrew K. Lampinen
ArticleOpen Access12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Photoinduced twist and untwist of moiré superlattices (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Photoinduced twist and untwist of moiré superlattices

Femtosecond photoexcitation drives a coherent twist–untwist motion of the moiré superlattice in 2° and 57° twisted WSe2/MoSe2 heterobilayers.

  • Cameron J. R. Duncan
  • Amalya C. Johnson
  • Fang Liu
Article12 Nov 2025

entry.title: A universal speed limit for spreading of coherence (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A universal speed limit for spreading of coherence

Experiments reveal a speed limit for the spreading of spatial coherence during the formation of a weakly interacting Bose–Einstein condensate.

  • Gevorg Martirosyan
  • Martin Gazo
  • Zoran Hadzibabic
ArticleOpen Access12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Silicon solar cells with hybrid back contacts (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Silicon solar cells with hybrid back contacts

Silicon solar cells with hybrid interdigitated back contacts have a power conversion efficiency approaching 95% of the theoretical limit and a fill factor approaching 98% of the theoretical limit.

  • Genshun Wang
  • Mingzhe Yu
  • Zhenguo Li
Article12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Rare genetic variants confer a high risk of ADHD and implicate neuronal biology (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Rare genetic variants confer a high risk of ADHD and implicate neuronal biology

An analysis of rare genetic variants identifies three genes—MAP1A, ANO8 and ANK2—that have a role in attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and investigates the potential underlying biological mechanisms.

  • Ditte Demontis
  • Jinjie Duan
  • Anders D. Børglum
ArticleOpen Access12 Nov 2025

entry.title: Synthesis of enantioenriched atropisomers by biocatalytic deracemization (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Synthesis of enantioenriched atropisomers by biocatalytic deracemization

A new method for deracemization of atropisomers is described which leverages a P450 enzyme-mediated process involving bond rotation for enantioenrichment.

  • Casey B. Roos
  • S. Luke Schulert
  • Alison R. H. Narayan
ArticleOpen Access12 Nov 2025

entry.title: An ancient recombination desert is a speciation supergene in placental mammals (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
An ancient recombination desert is a speciation supergene in placental mammals

Deep learning methods identified a large and evolutionarily conserved X-linked low recombination region in placental mammals that serves as both a barrier to gene flow in hybridizing lineages and an accurate phylogenomic marker.

  • Nicole M. Foley
  • Richard G. Rasulis
  • William J. Murphy
Article12 Nov 2025
